description: Change of use from a cosmetic surgery clinic to a hotel/guest house
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (1214-5, 1214-6, 1214-7, 1214-8, 1214-9, Cover Letter, Planning Statement & Location Plan. Received on 21 April 2021; Sustainability & Energy Statement. Received on 13 January 2022; 1214-1 Rev A, 1214-9 Rev A & Fire Safety Statement. Received on 8 February 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed hotel so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no residents (guests or staff) of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held
Condition : 5 - No customer of the development hereby approved shall reside at the premises for a period of greater than 30 consecutive days.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to the first occupation of the development, a plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority showing full details of the parking to take place on the site. These details shall include scale and location of parking spaces and tracking diagrams, and should include no car parking beyond the approved 2 disabled bays.  The works shall be carried out as approved before the development is first occupied and shall be retained thereafter.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the development, full details including plans and elevations of cycle parking facilities shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, including roofed shelters for both areas of cycle parking. The cycle store shall conform to current guidance such as the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (2017) and shall have a door measuring at least 1.2 metre wide. The works shall be carried out as approved before the development is first occupied and shall be retained thereafter.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the development, details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the development, details of wheelchair accessible rooms shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall be carried out as approved before the development is first occupied and shall be retained thereafter.
